title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A 
(Covid-19 Passenger Locator Form) 

– Temporary Requirements) 
(Amendment) (No. 4) Regulations 2021. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on the 31st day of October

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 2. Regulation 1 of the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary
text_raw:
2. Regulation 1 of the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary 
Requirements) (Covid-19 Passenger Locator Form) Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 
45 of 2021) is amended, in paragraph (3), by the substitution of “8th day of 
November 2021” for “31st day of October 2021”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

30 October, 2021. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 2nd November, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [565] 3

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations, made under section 31A of the Health Act 1947 (inserted 
by section 10 of the Health (Preservation and Protection and other Emergency 
Measures in the Public Interest) Act 2020), provide for the imposition of a 
requirement that international passengers (including Irish citizens) arriving into 
the State having been overseas in the prior 14-days complete a COVID 19 
Passenger Locator Form for the purposes of recording the details given on this 
form, to provide public health advice and for the purposes of contact tracing in 
relation to confirmed or suspected cases of Covid-19. 

This Instrument provides for the amendment of the Regulation through the 
substitution of 'the 8th day of November 2021' for 'the 31st day of October 
2021’. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [565]
